name: European Association of Social Anthropologists
goal:
The European Association of Social Anthropologists (EASA) is a professional association open to all social anthropologists either qualified in, or else working in, Europe.
The Association seeks to advance anthropology in Europe by organizing biennial conferences.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Communication, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Humanitarian Aid, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Investment, resarch and innovations, SMEs and single market- public consultation.
Horizon2020 proposals and ERC projects.
FP9 structure and involvement/participation of social sciences in major research programmes.
